text: New tutorial on added videos to dynamic pages <https://designers.HubSpot.com/how-to-add-videos-to-dynamic-pages-in-hubdb>

I'm building dynamic pages in HubDB and struggling a bit with how to format content. There's no way to put HTML into HubDB Rich Text fields, is there? Or the ability to somehow customize the formatting more in Rich Text fields beyond the few options available (ie. seeing the source like you can with the rich text module)?

As an example, on this page <http://alabcboard.gov/licensing-compliance/license-types-fees> is a table I want to include in a HubDB field, but copying and pasting it in messes up the formatting (I can first paste into a plain text editor and then paste into HubDB which is a little better, but still not great). I know I could put that type of data into a child table, but the problem is this is just an example of the data for one row and other rows won't all have the data in HTML tables, the data will be in all different formats, so a child table won't work. So I was hoping for something flexible to preserve some legible formatting of all different types of content we need to enter for this column.
you can paste styles content into the rich text field but the source wont be editable. it is better to create seperate columns for your needs.
On the topic of dynamic pages, wondering if there's a way to have different meta data for each dynamic page
HubDB's rich text editor isn't as fully-featured as the CMS one :disappointed:

Right, that's what I'm seeing. No good workaround, huh? Debating not using dynamic pages anymore and instead doing all 60 pages manually :disappointed: Some of our content is going to look too strange without more control of the rich text
You can! HubL evaluates in the meta description field, so you just need to do a {% if dynamic_page_hubdb_row %} in there
And you can either have some template or a specific column
There is an issue up to discuss switching these over to the same one the page editor uses
We are working on a solution to map these through the page editor
Thanks <@U6GNQ7JBU> for the update. Any idea on timeline for discussing that issue?
That works if you are coding your templates/
